Open Budget: Oakland visualizes the city's current and past budget data into accessible charts for the public. Data is published by the city. See Oakland's previous budgets, as well as the city's five-year forecast.

Mayor's 2019-21 Proposed Budget

The mayor's office released a proposed policy budget for fiscal years 2019 - 2020 and 2020 - 2021 in May 2019. The City Council approved a final (adopted) budget at the June 24th City Council meeting.

Did you know…

you can create your own visualizations with our free Open Budget Oakland API?

Comparison

Put two budgets head-to-head. How much did the budget grow or shrink? How are cuts and increases distributed across spending categories? How did revenue sources change?

Overview

Get a bird's eye view of the big picture for a single year: where money comes from, and where it goes.

Detail

Drill down into detailed spending and revenue data for each department and fund for a single year.

Timeline

Orient yourself within the two-year cycle of Oakland's budget process.
